H0.text: The crux of which novel is enabling 2,000 Allied soldiers to evacuate the island of Kheros. Crete

H1.text: The crux of which novel is enabling 2,000 Allied soldiers to evacuate the island of Kheros. Corregidor

H2.text: The crux of which novel is enabling 2,000 Allied soldiers to evacuate the island of Kheros. Malta

H3.text: The crux of which novel is enabling 2,000 Allied soldiers to evacuate the island of Kheros. Navarone

A4.text: The Cruel Sea is a 1951 novel by Nicholas Monsarrat that follows the lives of a group of Royal Navy sailors fighting the Battle of the Atlantic during the Second World War.

A5.text: The novel contains seven chapters, each describing a year during the war.

A6.text: The initial 11â€‘day battle was bloody and left more than 11,000 soldiers and civilians killed or wounded.

A7.text: Japanese troops forced the surrender of the remaining American and Filipino forces on May 6, 1942, under the command of Lieutenant General Jonathan Wainwright.

A8.text: The Spanish presence on Corregidor Island, which had lasted 328 years, came to an end.

A9.text: During the war, Malta played an important role for the Allies; being a British colony, situated close to Sicily and the Axis shipping lanes, Malta was bombarded by the Italian and German air forces.
